snippet: An operator was put on administrative leave Thursday after a train on Boston’s Red Line hurtled down the tracks without him. The train, carrying about 50 passengers, raced through four stations before it stopped.
abstract: Boston commuters who regularly use subway system's Red Line react to news of runaway train, which carried 50 terrified passengers through four above-ground stations without stopping; officials say operator of driverless train has been put on administrative leave and that they are investigating episode.
lead_paragraph: An operator was put on administrative leave Thursday after a train on Boston’s Red Line hurtled down the tracks without him. The train, carrying about 50 passengers, raced through four stations before it stopped.

headline.main: In Boston, a Runaway Ride on the Rails in the Dark
